alert.note: Alert for Liberty; McIntosh (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 15 at 8:57AM EDT until September 15 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Liberty and McIntosh. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 856 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Darien, Sapelo Island, Valona, Blackbeard Island, Shellman Bluff, Crescent, Meridian, Carnigan, Harris Neck, Wolf Island, Ridgeville, Halfmoon Landing, St. Catherines Island, Little Saint Simons Island, Raccoon Bluff and Ashintilly.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
